Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimal time of waiting before spawning a new hedged call.
Docs.remarks:
Default is set to 2 seconds.
You can also use to create all hedged tasks (value of ) at once or to force the hedging policy to never create new task before the old one is finished.
If you want a greater control over hedging delay customization use .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the delegate that is used to customize the hedging delays after each hedging task is created.
Docs.remarks:
The takes precedence over . If specified, the is ignored.
By default, this value is null.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum hedged attempts to perform the desired task.
Docs.value: The number of concurrent hedged tasks that will be triggered by the policy. The default value is 2.
Docs.remarks: This value includes the primary hedged task that is initially performed, and the further tasks that will be fetched from the provider and spawned in parallel. The value must be greater than or equal to 2, and less than or equal to 10.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the exception predicate to filter the type of exception the policy can handle.
Docs.remarks: By default any exception will be retried.
